summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 regarding final logistical details for an upcoming U.S. Department of Justice Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Executive Staff Meeting in Washington, DC. It includes a revised agenda and briefing materials for a session with a new ODAG (Office of the Deputy Attorney General) Liaison. The document reveals routine administrative planning within the BOP around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Dave
persons.context: Sends an email to the Executive Staff advising of a revised agenda for the upcoming meeting and providing logistical details about the canceled Philadelphia trip and the Washington, DC meeting arrangements.

events.title: Executive Staff Briefings to ODAG
events.description: A scheduled briefing session for the BOP Executive Staff with the new Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) Liaison, to be held from 9:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. in Washington, DC.

events.title: November 2019 Executive Staff Meeting
events.description: A future BOP Executive Staff meeting mentioned in the context of collecting funds for food.

locations: Hyatt Regency Washington on Capital Hill
keyFacts: The email is dated August 16, 2019, which is days after Jeffrey Epstein's death in BOP custody on August 10, 2019.
It details a scheduled high-level briefing between BOP Executive Staff and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) on August 20, 2019.
The document references a previously canceled Philadelphia hotel block and travel, indicating a change in meeting plans.
It shows routine internal BOP administrative operations, including agenda revisions, briefing book updates, and logistical planning for staff meetings.
The email mentions briefing a 'new ODAG Liaison,' suggesting a change or rotation in DOJ oversight personnel interacting with the BOP.
